title: Animation-Based Microlearning for Understanding Pendulum Clock Mechanisms

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental physics concepts (force, motion, energy) and mathematical graph interpretation skills
context.additional_context: 10-minute modular learning accessible via personal devices, combining animations and quizzes to enhance concentration.

learning_goals: Students can explain the interaction of the three core components (weight, pendulum, gears) that constitute the operating principle of a pendulum clock.
Students can quantitatively analyze temporal changes in physical phenomena by adjusting animation speed.
Students can connect the concept of pendulum periodicity to mathematical graphs when explaining the timekeeping mechanism of a clock.

resources: Mobile Learning App with Adjustable Speed Functionality

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
